sangoma::jsr309::JoinableContainer

JoinableContainer Class Reference

A Joinable object that contains multiple streams. Provides accessors to objects representing those streams. A JoinableStream is also a Joinable, and can be used in place of its container, to restrict a join operation for example. A JoinableContainer has a non-mutable number of streams, determined when the object is built. When a JoinableContainer A is joined to another JoinableContainer B, each stream of A is joined to the corresponding stream of B: audio to audio, video to video, etc. More...

#include <joinable.h>

Detailed Description

A Joinable object that contains multiple streams. Provides accessors to objects representing those streams. A JoinableStream is also a Joinable, and can be used in place of its container, to restrict a join operation for example. A JoinableContainer has a non-mutable number of streams, determined when the object is built. When a JoinableContainer A is joined to another JoinableContainer B, each stream of A is joined to the corresponding stream of B: audio to audio, video to video, etc.
